body:
I am getting an odd segfault when I try to inset a box in a map created with coast. The error seems to be tied to a particular coast command after which any inset command seems to give a segfault. Even with the error, the map produced is exactly as I would expect so output seems unaffected.

The exact options on inset seem to make no difference. Other, simpler, options on coast do not produce this error. The coast command I am using does not produce an error alone. Also the error occurs even when inset is left as an empty box, as in the code below.

```
gmt begin SegTest pdf
	gmt coast -R165E/175E/48S/40S -Jl170E/44S/42S/46S/1i -Wfaint
		gmt inset begin -Dn0/.65+w3i -F
		#gmt inset begin -DjTL+w3i -F -Vd
			#gmt coast -R120E/140W/70S/00S -JR3i -Gbrown -B0 -Sdeepskyblue1
		gmt inset end 
gmt end show
```

**Full error message**

<!-- Tip: you'll get more detailed error messages if you add -Vd to your gmt commands. -->

```
ERROR: Caught signal number 11 (Segmentation fault) at
0   libsystem_c.dylib                   0x00007fff67dd8ba4 flockfile + 18
1   ???                                 0x0000000000000068 0x0 + 104
Stack backtrace:
0   libgmt.6.0.0.dylib                  0x0000000106d826f7 sig_handler + 583
1   libsystem_platform.dylib            0x00007fff67f4a42d _sigtramp + 29
2   ???                                 0x0000000000000000 0x0 + 0
3   libsystem_c.dylib                   0x00007fff67dd95fe fgets + 42
4   libgmt.6.0.0.dylib                  0x0000000106e8676d GMT_inset + 2701
5   libgmt.6.0.0.dylib                  0x0000000106da0aef GMT_Call_Module + 1823
6   gmt                                 0x0000000106d77d9e main + 1998
7   libdyld.dylib                       0x00007fff67d517fd start + 1
inset [ERROR]: In end mode and information file does not exist: /Users/<UserDir>/.gmt/sessions/gmt6.2406/gmt.inset.0
```



**Actual outcome as expected**

<!--The output produced by the above script, which may be a screenshot, console output, etc.-->
[SegTest.pdf](https://github.com/GenericMappingTools/gmt/files/4238887/SegTest.pdf)



<!--A description of the expected outcome from the above script.-->

**System information**

* Operating system: MacOS 10.15.2 
Catalina - Not quite the latest patch

* GMT version (`gmt --version`): 6.0.0 
Installed with the darwin disk image.

title: inset + coast throws segmentation fault but output is still produced properly
